general: This law allows the government to spend money from the Consolidated Fund to pay for things like salaries, benefits, and other expenses for the years 2005 and 2006. It also says how much money can be spent each year. This helps the government manage its finances and make sure there is enough money to pay for everything it needs to do.

series.text:
* Simplified point 1: Authorizes the use of up to £6,742,891,000 from the Consolidated Fund for the service of the year ending March 31, 2005.
* Simplified point 2: Allows the Treasury to issue up to £7,621,925,000 from the Consolidated Fund for the service of the year ending March 31, 2005.
* Simplified point 3: Authorizes the use of up to £158,080,667,000 from the Consolidated Fund for the service of the year ending March 31, 2006.
* Simplified point 4: Allows the Treasury to issue up to £149,539,608,000 from the Consolidated Fund for the service of the year ending March 31, 2006.
* Simplified point 5: Provides that this Act may be cited as the Consolidated Fund (No. 2) Act 2004.

summary: The Consolidated Fund (No. 2) Act 2004 allows the government to spend money from the Consolidated Fund to pay for things like public services and debt repayment for the financial years ending March 31, 2005 and March 31, 2006. The government can use up to £6,742,891,000 from the fund for the year ending March 31, 2005, and up to £158,080,667,000 for the year ending March 31, 2006. This law also lets the Treasury borrow money from the fund to cover these costs. In other words, this act gives the government permission to spend money from the Consolidated Fund to pay for important things like healthcare, education, and debt repayment.
single:
* Authorizes the use of £6,742,891,000 for the service of the year ending with 31st March 2005.
* Authorizes the issue of £7,621,925,000 out of the Consolidated Fund for the year ending with 31st March 2005.
* Authorizes the use of £158,080,667,000 for the service of the year ending with 31st March 2006.
* Authorizes the issue of £149,539,608,000 out of the Consolidated Fund for the year ending with 31st March 2006.
* Short title: Consolidated Fund (No. 2) Act 2004.
This legislation authorizes the use of funds for the years ending with 31st March 2005 and 31st March 2006. It authorizes the use of £6,742,891,000 for the service of the year ending with 31st March 2005 and £158,080,667,000 for the service of the year ending with 31st March 2006. It also authorizes the issue of £7,621,925,000 and £149,539,608,000 out of the Consolidated Fund for the respective years. The short title of this legislation is the Consolidated Fund (No. 2) Act 2004.
